item.title: Jwhockaday add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Hello babies. Welcome to Earth. It's hot in the summer and cold in the winter. It's round and wet and crowded. On the outside, babies, you've got a hundred years here. There's only one rule that I know of, babies-"God damn it, you've got to be kind." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jwhockaday add a quote by ernest hemingway
item.description: "Courage is grace under pressure." -- ernest hemingway

item.title: Jwhockaday add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Yes, Boss?' Dorcas, the last twenty or thirty years I've been a worthless, no-good parasite.' She yawned again. 'Everybody knows that.' Nevermind the flattery. There comes a time in every man's life when he has to stop being sensible--a time to stand up and be counted--strike a blow for liberty--smite the wicked.' Ummm...' So quit yawning, the time has come.' She glanced down. 'Maybe I had better get dressed." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jwhockaday add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jwhockaday add a quote by Norman Douglas
item.description: "If you want to see what children can do, you must stop giving them things." -- Norman Douglas
